item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "The answer is never the answer. What's really interesting is the mystery. If you seek the mystery instead of the answer, you'll always be seeking. I've never seen anybody really find the answer. They think they have, so they stop thinking. But the job is to seek mystery, evoke mystery, plant a garden in which strange plants grow and mysteries bloom. The need for mystery is greater than the need for an answer." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Plant a garden in which strange plants grow and mysteries bloom." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Timothy Leary
item.description: "Why not? Yeah" -- Timothy Leary

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "[T]he infliction of cruelty with a good conscience is a delight to moralists. That is why they invented Hell." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Life has become immeasurably better since I have been forced to stop taking it seriously." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "It was obvious that he was a man who marched through life to the rhythms of some drum I would never hear." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Desperation is the raw material of drastic change. Only those who can leave behind everything they have ever believed in can hope to escape. " -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The basic tool for the manipulation of reality is the manipulation of words. If you can control the meaning of words, you can control the people who must use them." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Jonathan Coe
item.description: "I like the rain before it falls. of course there is no such thing, she said. That's why it's my favorite. Something can still make you happy, can't it, even if it isn't real." -- Jonathan Coe

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Stanislaw Lem
item.description: "Good books tell the truth, even when they're about things that never have been and never will be. They're truthful in a different way" -- Stanislaw Lem

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Terence McKenna
item.description: "Even as the nineteenth century had to come to grips with the notion of human descent from apes, we must now come to terms with the fact that those apes were stoned apes." -- Terence McKenna

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your <i>informed</i> opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "Don't start an argument with somebody who has a microphone when you don't. They'll make you look like chopped liver." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Wavy Gravy
item.description: "The whole earth is in jail and we're plotting this incredible jailbreak." -- Wavy Gravy

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Zakhar Prilepin
item.description: "Я успел выпить еще темного, со вкусом сеновала, пива, и теперь с удовольствием бы обнял по-дружески звезду рок-н-ролла – всякое быдло склонно как можно скорее наверстать разницу между собой и объектом восхищения, будь то сладкая женщина или сердечно почитаемый человек." -- Zakhar Prilepin

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Zakhar Prilepin
item.description: "Если мужчина хочет, чтоб его женщина не превратилась в печальную и постыдную бабу – он может любить ее как дочку. Но если женщина хочет, чтоб ее мужчина не превратился в постыдного и бесстыдного мужика – она никогда не должна относиться к нему как к сыну." -- Zakhar Prilepin

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Robert G. Ingersoll
item.description: "There are in nature neither rewards nor punishments — there are consequences." -- Robert G. Ingersoll

item.title: Hypphen add a quote by Dorothea Brande
item.description: "Act boldly and unseen forces will come to your aid." -- Dorothea Brande
